data.name: Sajek Valley
data.description: Sajek Valley is a popular tourist destination located in Rangamati, known for its scenic beauty and cloud views.

data.name: Nilgiri
data.description: Nilgiri is one of the highest peaks in Bangladesh located in Bandarban.

data.name: Keokradong
data.description: Keokradong is one of the tallest peaks in Bangladesh, ideal for trekkers.

data.name: Tajingdong
data.description: Tajingdong is the highest mountain in Bangladesh, popular among adventure lovers.

data.name: Chimbuk Hill
data.description: Chimbuk Hill is known as the Darjeeling of Bangladesh for its elevation and views.

data.name: Alikadam
data.description: Alikadam is a peaceful hill area in Bandarban known for its natural beauty.

data.name: Nilachal
data.description: Nilachal is a scenic tourist spot offering a panoramic view of Bandarban town.

data.name: Mayung Kopal
data.description: Mayung Kopal is a lesser-known but beautiful hilly destination in Khagrachari.

data.name: Sundarbans Mangrove Forest
data.description: The largest mangrove forest in the world and a UNESCO World Heritage site.

data.name: Ratargul Swamp Forest
data.description: A freshwater swamp forest in Sylhet, popular for boat tours.

data.name: Lawachara Rain Forest
data.description: An evergreen rainforest and national park with rich biodiversity.

data.name: Rema-Kalenga Reserve Forest
data.description: One of the largest and most diverse forests in Bangladesh.

data.name: Bhawal National Park
data.description: A popular forest park near Dhaka for picnics and nature walks.

data.name: Sitakunda Eco Park
data.description: A nature park in Chittagong with waterfalls and hiking trails.

data.name: Modhutila Eco Park
data.description: Eco-tourism spot with natural green hills and diverse wildlife.

data.name: Dulahazra Safari Park
data.description: A safari park with various animals and birds, popular with families.

data.name: Cox's Bazar Beach
data.description: Cox's Bazar is the longest natural sea beach in the world.

data.name: Inani Beach
data.description: Inani Beach is famous for its coral stones and crystal clear water.

data.name: Himchari Beach
data.description: Known for its waterfall and hilly backdrop next to the sea.

data.name: Saint Martin's Island
data.description: The only coral island of Bangladesh located in the Bay of Bengal.

data.name: Kuakata Beach
data.description: Known as 'Daughter of the Sea', it's the only place to see both sunrise and sunset over the sea.

data.name: Patenga Beach
data.description: A popular beach close to Chittagong city.

data.name: Teknaf Beach
data.description: Located at the southern tip of Bangladesh, it's a calm and uncrowded beach.

data.name: Ramna Park
data.description: A large park with trees and gardens in the heart of Dhaka.

data.name: National Botanical Garden
data.description: The largest plant conservation center in Bangladesh.

data.name: Baldha Garden
data.description: A historical botanical garden in Wari, Dhaka.

data.name: Gazipur Safari Park
data.description: A safari park near Dhaka with wildlife and nature views.

data.name: Nandan Park
data.description: A popular amusement and water park in Savar.

data.name: Fantasy Kingdom
data.description: One of the top amusement parks in Bangladesh with rides and entertainment.

data.name: Shishu Park
data.description: An old amusement park designed for children in Dhaka.

data.name: Wonderland Park
data.description: A family amusement park located in Chittagong.

data.name: Bangladesh National Museum
data.description: The largest museum in Bangladesh showcasing history, art and culture.

data.name: Science Museum
data.description: National Science and Technology Museum showcasing innovation.
